description: First-semester music majors begin formal musicianship studies. Students perform basic melodies and rhythms at sight, and notate dictations of basic rhythms, melodies and harmonic progressions. Students also analyze and compose Western tonal music employing the rubrics of rhythm and meter, pitch, intervals, scales, tertian chords, inversions, harmonic progression, and SATB voice leading. Offered annually in the fall semester. Does not count toward B.A. music major or any B.M. music major. Prerequisite: concurrent registration in MUSIC 161 (or placement into a higher level of keyboard proficiency).
name: Introduction to Musicianship
notes: This class is open only to approved music majors.
Supplemental Instruction (SI) is available for this course.
This course is closed until new student registration.
prerequisites: concurrent registration in MUSIC 161 (or placement into a higher level of keyboard proficiency).
